Quotations.ab: Ka pēš az ẏeŋ́hē hātąm frōd hišt astbed frabardār frāz barišn. Ka nē, †hāwanān kē ʾMT-š andar kard u-š be stānišn. Ka pad ẏeŋ́hē hātąm frōd hilēd ā-š pad humatanąm be dārišn. Ka pad humatanąmbe hilēd tā hān IV ẏaθā ahū vairiiō ud III aṣ̌əm vohū *ōh dārišn. Wehšābuhr guft hād pad kardag ka-š frōd hilēd, tā-š be xward ā-š az-iš be nē dāštan.

"If (the zōt) has put it down before ẏeŋ́hē hātąm, the frabardār should take the meat on the bone. If (he) did not do it, the hāwanān, who filled (the bowl), should take it up. If (he) puts it down at ẏeŋ́hē hātąm, then he should hold it at humatanąm. If he puts it down at humatanąm, he should hold it during the whole four ẏaθā ahū vairiiō and the three aṣ̌əm vohū. Wehšābuhr had said: "in the practice, if (he) has put it down, he must not take it away unitl (the fire) has consumed it."
